page.title: 01The Gayton/Tiffield Area
page.content: This area is essentially a rural area. It contains one small community - the village of Gayton, a hamlet of five houses called Dalscote and touches upon the edges of Tiffield and Eastcote. The whole area is elevated above 125 feet and contains no substantial stretches of water or rivers. The small streams are mainly drainage ditches for the farms which dominate the area. Arable (essentially cereals),grazing, and some horse-rearing are pursued at these farms. Overhead power-lines traverse the area from South-East to North-West and several cuttings run from North to South, a reminder of days gone by when the region was served by a substantial rail network. The latter transported people to the Gayton Golf Course, now ploughed up.
